Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Polymer \Pol"y*mer\, n. [See {Polymeric}.] (Chem.) Any one of two or more substances related to each other by polymerism; specifically, a substance produced from another substance by chemical polymerization. [Formerly also written polymere.] [1913 Webster]
polymer n : a naturally occurring or synthetic compound consisting of large molecules made up of a linked series of repeated simple monomers
